docs.snippet: The receding ice has opened new passageways for high-speed internet cables. Point Hope, a gravel spit in northwest Alaska, is along one of the new routes.

headline.print_headline: Arctic Ice Melts, and a Digital Rush Follows
headline.main: Melting Arctic Ice Makes High-Speed Internet a Reality in a Remote Town

docs.snippet: With the fresh, spicy character typical of cool-climate viticulture, the red-wine grape shows another face of American winemaking.

headline.main: Cabernet Franc and the Finger Lakes: Made for Each Other

docs.snippet: A brewing Republican vs. Republican fight could test whether the anti-incumbent insurgency backed by Stephen K. Bannon becomes a credible national movement.

headline.main: Conservatives, With Bannon’s Help, Look for Revenge in Mississippi

docs.snippet: To write “Nomadland,” Jessica Bruder spent three years traveling and working alongside grandparents and others living in school buses and vans seeking seasonal work.

headline.main: On the Road With the Casualties of the Great Recession

docs.snippet: Spelman and Morehouse, the historically black colleges in Atlanta, are among a number of schools nationwide fielding complaints about sexual misconduct.

docs.snippet: After Jennifer Lawrence and Darren Aronofsky offered their explanation of the film, you offered your verdict. Thumbs down doesn’t even begin to describe it.

docs.snippet: All the raves you’ve heard are true. Kauai is a lush island with just the right mix of amenities and untamed beauty.
